ec2-public-instances-stepfunction-remedi.description:
Detect public EC2 instances and invoke Step Function for automated remediation workflow.
This policy triggers a Step Function that handles notification, tagging, and remediation
of publicly accessible EC2 instances.

ec2-public-instances-periodic-check.description:
Periodic check for public EC2 instances using Step Function remediation.
Runs every 6 hours to catch instances that may have been missed by real-time monitoring.

ec2-public-ip-vpc-deployed.description:
Event-driven policy deployed inside VPC for enhanced security.
Automatically terminates EC2 instances launched with public IP addresses.
This policy demonstrates Cloud Custodian Lambda deployment within a VPC.

ec2-untagged-instances-vpc-periodic.description:
Periodic policy running inside VPC.
Scans all EC2 instances daily for missing required tags.
Demonstrates scheduled VPC-deployed Lambda function.

This policy triggers on GuardDuty findings and takes automated remediation actions.

config-compliance-violations.description:
Respond to AWS Config rule compliance violations in real-time.
This policy triggers when resources become non-compliant with Config rules.

securityhub-critical-findings.description:
Respond to AWS Security Hub critical and high severity findings from CSPM controls.
This includes AWS Foundational Security Best Practices and CIS benchmarks.

macie-sensitive-data-findings.description:
Respond to AWS Macie sensitive data discovery findings in S3 buckets.
This policy triggers when Macie detects PII, credentials, or sensitive data.

iam-access-analyzer-external-access.description:
Respond to IAM Access Analyzer findings indicating external access to resources.
This policy triggers when resources are shared with external principals.

s3-access-logs-suspicious-activity.description:
Monitor S3 access logs for suspicious activity patterns.
This policy analyzes S3 access logs and triggers on anomalous access patterns.

cloudtrail-security-events.description:
Monitor AWS CloudTrail for high-risk security events and configuration changes.
This policy triggers on critical API calls that may indicate security issues.

ec2-public-instance-stepfunction-realtim.description:
Real-time detection of EC2 instances launched with public IP addresses.
Immediately triggers Step Function workflow for automated risk assessment 
and remediation based on risk level (HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW).

ec2-public-instance-stepfunction-periodi.description:
Periodic scan for existing EC2 instances with public IP addresses.
Runs hourly to catch instances that may have been missed by real-time detection
or had their networking configuration changed after launch.

security-findings-daily-summary.description:
Daily summary of all security findings from various AWS security services.
This provides a consolidated view of the security posture.

aws-security-hub-critical-findings.description: Notifies of new critical findings in Security Hub

ec2-untagged-instances.description:
Find EC2 instances that are missing required tags.
This is a common compliance requirement for cost allocation and governance.

ebs-oversized-volumes.description:
Find EBS volumes larger than 100GB that are available (unattached).
These might be candidates for cost optimization.

s3-unencrypted-buckets.description:
Find S3 buckets that don't have default encryption enabled.
This is a security best practice to protect data at rest.

security-groups-ssh-unrestricted.description:
Find security groups that allow SSH (port 22) access from anywhere (0.0.0.0/0).
This is a security risk and should be restricted.

elastic-ips-unused.description:
Find Elastic IP addresses that are allocated but not associated
with any instance. These incur charges without providing value.

rds-backup-disabled.description:
Find RDS instances that don't have automated backups enabled.
This is important for data protection and compliance.

lambda-public-access.description:
Find Lambda functions that have resource-based policies
allowing public access. This could be a security risk.

ec2-stopped-instances-old.description:
Find EC2 instances that have been stopped for more than 30 days.
These might be candidates for termination to save costs.

iam-users-old-access-keys.description:
Find IAM users with access keys that haven't been rotated
in more than 90 days. This is a security best practice.

ec2-low-utilization.description:
Find EC2 instances with low CPU utilization over the past 14 days.
These might be candidates for downsizing or termination.

ebs-unattached-volumes.description:
Find EBS volumes that are not attached to any instance.
These incur storage costs.

ebs-old-snapshots.description:
Find EBS snapshots older than 90 days that might be
safe to delete for cost savings.

rds-oversized-instances.description:
Find RDS instances that might be oversized based on
CPU and connection metrics.

elb-no-targets.description:
Find Classic Load Balancers with no registered instances.
These incur costs without providing value.

elbv2-no-targets.description:
Find Application/Network Load Balancers with no targets
or very low request count.

reserved-instances-unused.description:
Find Reserved Instances that are not being fully utilized.
These represent wasted pre-paid capacity.

cloudwatch-large-log-groups.description:
Find CloudWatch log groups that are very large and might
benefit from log retention policy optimization.

lambda-unused-functions.description:
Find Lambda functions that haven't been invoked recently.
While Lambda has no cost when not running, these might be cleanup candidates.

ec2-untagged-instances-realtime.description:
Monitor EC2 instances in real-time and automatically tag untagged instances.
Triggers on EC2 instance launch events.

s3-public-bucket-remediation-realtime.description:
Monitor S3 buckets in real-time and automatically secure public buckets.
Triggers when S3 buckets are created or modified.

security-group-ssh-remediation-realtime.description:
Monitor security groups in real-time and remove unrestricted SSH access.
Triggers when security group rules are modified.

iam-policy-monitoring-realtime.description:
Monitor IAM policies in real-time for overly permissive policies.
Triggers when IAM policies are created or modified.

ebs-unencrypted-volumes-scheduled.description:
Scheduled check for unencrypted EBS volumes.
Runs every hour to ensure continuous compliance.

rds-public-access-remediation-realtime.description:
Monitor RDS instances in real-time and flag publicly accessible databases.
Triggers when RDS instances are created or modified.

s3-public-buckets.description:
Find S3 buckets that are publicly accessible.
This is a critical security issue that needs immediate attention.

security-groups-wide-open.description:
Find security groups with rules that allow all traffic (0.0.0.0/0)
on sensitive ports. This is a security risk.

iam-admin-access-check.description:
Find IAM users and roles with admin-level permissions.
These should be regularly reviewed for security.

nat-gateways-unused.description:
Find NAT Gateways that might not be actively used.
These are expensive and should be reviewed for cost optimization.

cloudtrail-not-enabled.description:
Find CloudTrail trails that are not logging or not configured properly.
This is required for compliance and security monitoring.
